metadata.title: Dungeons & Dragons Starter Set: Dragons of Stormwreck Isle

adventure.summary: Dragons of Stormwreck Isle draws characters into an ancient war among dragons on a small island marked by magical scars of dead dragons. Players explore Dragon's Rest cloister, investigate sea caves, a cursed shipwreck, and a clifftop observatory while facing living dragons, undead, and magical threats.
adventure.background: Two dragon families, chromatic and metallic, have a longstanding animosity originating from the gods Bahamut and Tiamat. Stormwreck Isle was formed from the volcanic activity caused by the imprisoned red dragon Sharruth. Magic on the island draws dragons and leaves magical scars, making it a battlefield for these families. Runara, an adult bronze dragon disguised as a human, founded Dragon's Rest as a haven for peace. Recently, aggressive forces threaten the island's fragile tranquility.

hooks.description: The adventurers are brought together at the cloister of Dragon's Rest seeking peace, knowledge, or personal quests.
Runara requests help to investigate the unusual zombie activity from nearby shipwrecks.
Tarak asks the characters to visit the sea caves to aid the myconids and find rare mushrooms.
The characters learn about Sparkrender's evil plans and the ancient observatory on the island.

quests.name: Zombie Resurgence
quests.description: Investigate and resolve the threat of zombies attacking Dragon's Rest, linked to cursed shipwrecks.
objectives: Fight the zombies attacking Dragon's Rest.
Investigate the source of the zombie curse on the island.
Recover Aleitha's talisman from the shipwreck of Compass Rose.
Bring the talisman to Brastos's grave to end the curse.
rewards: Remove zombie threat from Dragon's Rest

quests.name: Seagrow Caves
quests.description: Assist the myconids suffering from a blight due to blocked volcanic vents and confront their fungal and elemental guardians.
objectives: Destroy the orange crystal blocking the vent to stop the blight.
Defeat fungal violet fungus and fume drakes.
Return to Dragon's Rest with the myconids' glowing red fungus.

quests.name: Cursed Shipwreck
quests.description: Explore the shipwreck of Compass Rose to discover and stop the curse animating zombies and confront the harpy.
objectives: Explore the shipwreck and fight zombies and ghoul.
Defeat or reason with the harpy.
Retrieve Aleitha's talisman from the captain's chest.
Bring the talisman to the graveyard to break the curse.
rewards: Treasure from the shipwreck including boots of elvenkind and gems

quests.name: Clifftop Observatory
quests.description: Confront Sparkrender the blue dragon wyrmling and foil his ritual to claim power over the island's dead dragons, and rescue Aidron the bronze wyrmling.
objectives: Deal with Sparkrender and his kobold allies.
Disrupt Sparkrender's ritual using the dragon effigies or destroy the effigies.
rewards: Potion of Healing and an exquisite pearl from Runara

AREA:DRAGONS_REST.name: Dragon's Rest
AREA:DRAGONS_REST.description: A quiet cloister on a cliffside overlooking the sea, home to Elder Runara and her followers, including kobolds, humans, and hermits seeking peace.
AREA:DRAGONS_REST.notes: Center of operations for adventurers with home base facilities, kitchen, library, and temple of Bahamut.

AREA:SEAGROW_CAVES.name: Seagrow Caves
AREA:SEAGROW_CAVES.description: Dark sea caves inhabited by myconids, twisted by volcanic poisonous fumes and guarded by fungal and elemental creatures.
AREA:SEAGROW_CAVES.notes: Affected by toxic fumes due to blocked vent, contains the entrance to the tomb of red dragon Sharruth.

AREA:COMPASS_ROSE_SHIPWRECK.name: Compass Rose Shipwreck
AREA:COMPASS_ROSE_SHIPWRECK.description: The wreck of a ship cursed by undead sailors and haunted by a harpy; site of treasure and dark magic.
AREA:COMPASS_ROSE_SHIPWRECK.notes: Held up by dragon bones, mostly above water, contains cursed talisman.

AREA:CLIFFTOP_OBSERVATORY.name: Clifftop Observatory
AREA:CLIFFTOP_OBSERVATORY.description: Ruined magical observatory built on basalt spires with magical bridges, home to Sparkrender and the imprisoned bronze wyrmling Aidron.
AREA:CLIFFTOP_OBSERVATORY.notes: Site of the final confrontation with Sparkrender, contains magic sculpture and dragon effigies.

ROOM:A1.name: Path and Monastic Cells
ROOM:A1.description: The path leading from the shore up the cliff with six monastic cells carved into the rock, garden plots, and a dragon statue.
features: Stone dragon statue of Astalagan
Six simple monastic cells (including cells for Tarak, Varnoth, Myla, and others)
Garden plots with herbs and vegetables

ROOM:A2.name: Winch House
ROOM:A2.description: A small building equipped with a winch that lowers and raises pallets to the water below.
features: Sturdy wooden pallet on an iron chain
Lever to lock and release winch

ROOM:A3.name: Kitchen and Dining Room
ROOM:A3.description: Shared dining and kitchen space with a long table, chairs, and kitchen facilities.
features: Long table and benches
Tidy kitchen
Regular shared meals and cooking schedule

ROOM:A4.name: Library
ROOM:A4.description: A large library with books focused on theology and history, including magical and historical texts.
features: Oak door with iron bands
Shelves filled with books and scrolls
Table with writing implements and lamps

ROOM:A5.name: Temple of Bahamut
ROOM:A5.description: Open-air temple perched on cliff edge with a large stone statue of Bahamut surrounded by incense offerings.
features: Stone statue of Bahamut with seven canaries
Protective magic granting saving throw bonuses
Runara often present for quiet contemplation

ROOM:B1.name: Entrance Tunnel
ROOM:B1.description: A flooded sea cave tunnel with multicolored bioluminescent fungi covering the walls and spore patterns in the water.
features: Water level varies with tides
Spore servant octopus lurking underwater as guardian

encounters.description: The spore servant attacks any non-myconid creature entering the area.

ROOM:B2.name: Fungus Farm
ROOM:B2.description: Large cavern with mushroom growth and myconid sprouts and adults working among them.
features: Giant mushrooms, natural stone stairway
Heart cap mushrooms ready for harvest

encounters.description: Violet fungi attack with rotting touch when approached.

ROOM:B3.name: Larder
ROOM:B3.description: A foul-smelling cave with myconid sprouts and a stirge nest concealed on walls and ceiling.
features: Six stirges nest here
Myconid sprouts collecting fertilizer

encounters.description: Six stirges emerge from nest and attack characters.

ROOM:B4.name: Circle Chamber
ROOM:B4.description: Large cavern with clusters of giant mushrooms and six adult myconids.
features: Myconids in trance state (meld)
Adults tend to others and defend intruders

ROOM:B5.name: Sinensa's Sanctum
ROOM:B5.description: Sanctuary chamber for the myconid leader Sinensa, who is unconscious and guarded.
features: Large glowing red fungus (ruby morel)
Myconid adults Auranta and Enok tending to Sinensa

ROOM:B6.name: Crystal Cave
ROOM:B6.description: Cave choked with sulfurous smoke, orange crystal blocking a fissure, and two fume drakes.
features: Orange crystal egg case blocking volcanic vent
Two greenish smoke fume drakes
Breaking the crystal releases a fire snake

encounters.description: Fume drakes attack any intruder in the cave.
Hatches from the broken orange crystal egg and attacks immediately.

ROOM:C1.name: Main Deck
ROOM:C1.description: The upper deck of the shipwreck with algae-covered wood, rigging, masts, and doors leading below decks.
features: Crow's nest occupied by harpy
Access to captain's quarters and lower decks

ROOM:C2.name: Forecastle
features: Useless ballista

ROOM:C3.name: Quarterdeck
ROOM:C3.description: Rear deck with broken mast and dislodged ship wheel.
features: Ship's wheel with compass inlaid with mother-of-pearl

triggers.condition: Character attempts to catch falling ship wheel
triggers.effect: On failed Dexterity saving throw, loud noise attracting zombies

ROOM:C4.name: Captain's Quarters
ROOM:C4.description: Barricaded room with captain's belongings and a hole in the floor.
features: Two zombies inside
Hidden trap dart in floorboard
Access hole to lower deck hold

encounters.description: Two zombies attack as soon as door is forced open.

items: Captain's journal and talisman in hold

triggers.effect: Shoots dart dealing piercing and poison damage; Constitution save or take poison damage
triggers.disarm: Lift floorboard from safe distance or disable trap

ROOM:C5.name: Galley
ROOM:C5.description: Empty kitchen area with remains of a headless skeleton and harmless crabs.

ROOM:C6.name: Crew Quarters
ROOM:C6.description: Lodging area with six double bunks, personal items, and a portrait.
features: Hidden floorboard with trap and 200 gp stash

ROOM:C7.name: Mess Hall
ROOM:C7.description: Large dining area filled with broken chairs and plates.

ROOM:C8.name: Lower Deck
ROOM:C8.description: Flooded lower deck with scattered crates and water, home to a zombie and a ghoul.
features: Water depth varies across area causing difficult terrain
Holes to upper deck
Creeping ghoul ambush

encounters.description: Zombie attacks anyone entering the area.
Ghoul waits to ambush party while distracted by zombie.

ROOM:C9.name: Hold
ROOM:C9.description: Submerged ship hold with seaweed, debris, air bubbles, captain's chest, and journal.
features: Access to lower deck
Captain's chest contains talisman and boots of elvenkind
Captain's journal with cursed talisman description
items: Captain's chest with 55 gp, three turquoise stones and boots of elvenkind

ROOM:D1.name: Overlook
ROOM:D1.description: A cliff edge with two marble dragon statues with hexagonal indentations for moonstone key.
features: Inserting moonstone key activates magical bridge to observatory ruins.

triggers.condition: Moonstone key inserted into statue base
triggers.effect: Bridge of magical energy extends to observatory

ROOM:D2.name: Rotunda Ruins
ROOM:D2.description: Large plaza with broken statues, a celestial sculpture,and a fight between kobolds and stirges.
features: Golden astronomical sculpture
Dragon effigies representing five dragons
Kobolds (Mek and Minn) fighting stirges

encounters.description: Swarming the area and attacking kobolds and adventurers.
Mek and Minn, hostile or friendly based on player actions.

items: Dragon effigies of Astalagan (Bronze), Clyssavar (Gold), Eldenemir (Blue), Sharruth (Red), Turadaer (Brass)
Coins and minor treasure in ruins

ROOM:D3.name: Kobold Camp
ROOM:D3.description: A rickety driftwood and rope bridge to a ruined tower inhabited by hostile kobolds.
features: Hostile kobolds (Ekrash, Erp, Hev) and winged kobolds (Nuhro, Snirke)

encounters.description: Initially hostile; can be intimidated or reasoned with.

ROOM:D4.name: Isolated Study
ROOM:D4.description: Small tower with collapsed floor, old tomes, and a locked journal with a magical trap.
features: Arcane rune trap on the journal
Secret compartment with potion of resistance and 10 gp
Clues to unlock hidden observatory library entrance

triggers.effect: Releases green poison gas, deals poison damage
triggers.disarm: DC 11 Intelligence (Arcana) check and physical scratching of rune

ROOM:D5.name: Observatory Tower
ROOM:D5.description: Tall stained glass tower housing Sparkrender the blue dragon wyrmling and a celestial star map.
features: Stained glass dome with star map
Four alabaster scholar statues that rotate
Moonstone key pulley lift access

encounters.description: Blue dragon wyrmling, hostile or negotiable initially, uses breath weapon.

items: Treasure hoard including coins, gems, enchanted items

ROOM:D6.name: Secret Library
ROOM:D6.description: Hidden library accessed by spiral stairs, filled with old tomes and rubble, home to imprisoned bronze wyrmling Aidron.
features: Bookshelves and arcane tomes
Rubble blocking exits, requiring time and stealth to clear quietly
Aidron the bronze dragon wyrmling, imprisoned and distressed

encounters.description: Bronze dragon wyrmling eager to escape and defeat Sparkrender.

NPC:Runara.role: Leader of Dragon's Rest, adult bronze dragon in human guise
NPC:Runara.description: Wise, peace-loving dragon who seeks to end conflicts between chromatic and metallic dragons. Appears as an elderly human woman.
NPC:Runara.personality: Indifferent initially, becomes friendly with trust, hostile if harmed.
NPC:Runara.goals: Promote peace, protect Dragon's Rest, stop island conflicts, guide adventurers.
NPC:Runara.location: Dragon's Rest, secret lair in undersea cave

NPC:Tarak.description: Human male tending cloister's garden; knowledgeable about herbs and myconids.
NPC:Tarak.personality: Soft spoken, helpful but defensive about past, initially friendly but hostile if pressed.
NPC:Tarak.goals: Protect myconids, produce potions, seek peace on island.
NPC:Tarak.location: Dragon's Rest, cell in monastic cells

NPC:Varnoth.description: Gruff but empathetic woman with scars and a prosthetic leg.
NPC:Varnoth.personality: Indifferent to visitors but respects second chances, friendly if engaged in history or ethics discussion.
NPC:Varnoth.goals: Seek redemption and peace, maintain cloister.
NPC:Varnoth.location: Dragon's Rest, cell in monastic cells

NPC:Myla.description: Injured kobold experimenting with alchemy and engineering.
NPC:Myla.goals: Recovery of her wings, support Runara, build devices.
NPC:Myla.location: Dragon's Rest, cell in monastic cells

NPC:Mek and NPC:Minn.role: Winged kobold brothers allied with Sparkrender
NPC:Mek and NPC:Minn.description: Loyal but cruel kobolds who abandoned Myla.

NPC:Ekrash, NPC:Erp, NPC:Hev.description: Hostile kobolds at Clifftop Observatory camp.

NPC:Nuhro and NPC:Snirke.description: Members of kobold camp, loyal to Sparkrender.

NPC:Aidron.role: Bronze dragon wyrmling imprisoned by Sparkrender
NPC:Aidron.description: Young bronze dragon, former student of Runara, seeks freedom and peace.
NPC:Aidron.personality: Determined, regretful over conflict with Sparkrender.

MON:Zombie.description: Mindless reanimated corpses of drowned sailors animating on shipwrecks.
MON:Zombie.tactics: Advance slowly to engage in melee; use Dash to close distances if needed; utilize Undead Fortitude special trait.

MON:Stirge.description: Small winged pests that feed on blood by attaching to prey.
MON:Stirge.tactics: Attack with blood drain; attach to target and drain health over time; can be detached.

MON:Fume Drake.description: Legless smoke dragons that exhale scalding steam and cause confusion.
MON:Fume Drake.tactics: Use Scalding Breath cone attack, bite in melee; death causes poison burst.

MON:Violet Fungus.description: Giant purple fungi that move slowly and attack with rotting necrotic touch.
MON:Violet Fungus.tactics: Attack slowly with rotting touch; use false appearance to ambush.

MON:Spore Servant Octopus.description: Reanimated giant octopus controlled by myconid spores, bludgeoning attackers.
MON:Spore Servant Octopus.tactics: Attack with tentacles, can breathe only underwater.

MON:Ghoul.description: Undead hides in dark places, attacks in packs, paralyzes victims.
MON:Ghoul.tactics: Paralyze with claws then attack; attacks strongly in packs.

MON:Harpy.description: Humanoid winged creature using Luring Song to charm victims before attacking.
MON:Harpy.tactics: Use Luring Song to charm; attacks with claws and club; can be reasoned with.

MON:Kobold.description: Small reptilian humanoids with pack tactics and sunlight sensitivity.
MON:Kobold.tactics: Attack with daggers and slings, use pack tactics.

MON:Kobold Tinkerer.description: Kobold with alchemical flame attack and detect magic ability.
MON:Kobold Tinkerer.tactics: Uses Alchemical Flame cone and melee dagger attacks.

MON:Winged Kobold.description: Kobold with leathery wings enabling flight, uses daggers and rock attacks.
MON:Winged Kobold.tactics: Flies to gain advantage, attacks with dagger or dropped rocks.

MON:Fire Snake.description: Larval salamanders from the Elemental Plane of Fire with fiery attacks and heated body.
MON:Fire Snake.tactics: Bite and tail attack with fire damage; damages melee attackers on contact.

MON:Blue Dragon Wyrmling.description: Vain, territorial blue dragon with lightning breath and repulsion breath.
MON:Blue Dragon Wyrmling.tactics: Uses lightning breath in a line and repulsion breath in cone; bites in melee.

MON:Bronze Dragon Wyrmling.description: Noble bronze dragon with lightning and repulsion breaths, amphibious.
MON:Bronze Dragon Wyrmling.tactics: Bite and breath attacks; can assist characters against Sparkrender.

MON:Adult Bronze Dragon Runara.description: Leader of Dragon's Rest, powerful bronze dragon in human form with electrical and repulsion breath weapons.
MON:Adult Bronze Dragon Runara.tactics: Multiattack with bite and claws, uses breath weapons, legendary resistance, change shape ability.

MON:Owlbear.description: Large predatory beast with owl head and bear body, ferocious and stubborn.
MON:Owlbear.tactics: Multiattack with beak and claws; has keen sight and smell.

MON:Myconid Sprout.description: Small fungus creatures with distress and rapport spores; vulnerable to sunlight.
MON:Myconid Sprout.tactics: Fist attack with poison damage; can communicate telepathically with spores.

MON:Myconid Adult.description: Larger fungus creatures practicing melds, with pacifying spores and telepathic communication.
MON:Myconid Adult.tactics: Multiattack with fist and hallucinatory spores; protect colony.

MON:Sinensa.description: Leader of the myconids, currently unconscious and protected by others.
MON:Sinensa.tactics: Multiattack with fist and hallucinatory spores; commands rapport spores.

ITEM:Boots of Elvenkind.description: While wearing these boots, steps make no sound and wearer has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks related to moving silently.

ITEM:Elixir of Health.description: Cures disease and removes blinded, deafened, paralyzed, and poisoned conditions.
location: Reward from Tarak at Dragon's Rest
Reward from Runara at Dragon's Rest

ITEM:Potion of Resistance.description: Grants resistance to one damage type for 1 hour.
location: Found in isolated study at Clifftop Observatory

ITEM:Weapon +1.description: Grants +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

events.description: If a character party is defeated by zombies, Runara rescues them, reviving them in the temple at Dragon's Rest.
events.outcome: Characters revived and healed; Runara remains mysterious about her intervention.

events.description: Breaking the orange crystal in Seagrow Caves releases a fire snake and allows toxic fumes to vent, stopping the blight.
events.outcome: Fire snake attacks; myconid blight begins to heal.

events.description: Harpy returns to shipwreck after characters rest or disturb the captain's chest.
events.outcome: Harpy attempts to lure characters and new ships to their doom.

events.description: Sparkrender initiates a ritual using dragon effigies to bind spirits of dead dragons to himself.
events.outcome: Adventurers must disrupt ritual through combat or magic to prevent Sparkrender's ascension.

triggers.condition: Characters start to ascend path at Dragon's Rest
triggers.effect: Three zombies emerge from the water and approach characters

triggers.condition: Character attempts to catch falling ship wheel

triggers.effect: All myconids within 240 feet sense distress and respond accordingly
All humanoids and giants within 300 feet must make Wisdom save or be charmed

traps.effect: Shoots a dart dealing 2d4 piercing and 3d6 poison damage
traps.disarm: Disarm by lifting from safe distance or DC 11 Dexterity check with thieves' tools

traps.trigger: Magical journal opened without disarming rune trap
traps.effect: Emits poisonous green gas causing 3d6 poison damage
traps.disarm: Disarm trap by scratching rune with sharp tool and DC 11 Intelligence (Arcana) check
